009package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012import java.awt.geom.FlatteningPathIterator;
013import java.awt.geom.PathIterator;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017
018/**
019 * A small wrapper class to create a simple {@link Iterator} of {@link Pnt2d} to
020 * step over the individual points of a AWT {@link Shape} object. Curved shapes
021 * are flattened by a {@link FlatteningPathIterator}.
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @see PathIterator
025 * @see FlatteningPathIterator
026 */
027public class ShapePointIterator implements Iterator<Pnt2d> {
028        
029        private final PathIterator pi;
030        private final double coords[] = new double[6];
031        
032        public ShapePointIterator(Shape shape, double flatness) {
033                this.pi = shape.getPathIterator(null, flatness);
034        }
035
036        @Override
037        public boolean hasNext() {
038                return !pi.isDone();
039        }
040
041        @Override
042        public Pnt2d next() {
043                if (pi.isDone()) {
044                        return null;
045                }
046                else {
047                        pi.currentSegment(coords);
048                        pi.next();
049                        return Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]);
050                }
051        }
052
053        
054//      public static void main(String[] args) {
055//              Pnt2d ctr = Pnt2d.from(20, 30);
056//              GeometricCircle gc = new GeometricCircle(20, 30, 100);
057//              Shape circle = gc.getShape();
058//              System.out.println("circle = " + circle);
059//              
060////            ShapePointIterator iter = new ShapePointIterator(circle, 0.01);
061////            while(iter.hasNext()) {
062////                    Pnt2d p = iter.next();
063////                    System.out.println(p + " dist = " + gc.getDistance(p));
064////            }
065//              
066//              System.out.println("checkShape = " + gc.checkShape(circle, 0.5));
067//              
068//      }
069}
